Class Tracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.piwik.sdk.Tracker

  • public class Tracker
extends Object
    Main tracking class This class is threadsafe.

      Case Tracker.ExtraIdentifier.APK_CHECKSUM:

      • Tracker

        protected Tracker(String url,
       int siteId,
       String authToken,
       Piwik piwik)
           throws MalformedURLException
        Use Piwik.newTracker() method to create new trackers
        Parameters:
        url - (required) Tracking HTTP API endpoint, for example, http://your-piwik-domain.tld/piwik.php
        siteId - (required) id of site
        authToken - (optional) could be null
        piwik - piwik object used to gain access to application params such as name, resolution or lang
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException

      • getDefaultTrackMe

        public TrackMe getDefaultTrackMe()
        Piwik will use the content of this object to fill in missing values before any transmission. While you can modify it's values, you can also just set them in your TrackMe object as already set values will not be overwritten.
        Returns:
        the default TrackMe object

      • dispatch

        public boolean dispatch()
        Processes all queued events in background thread
        Returns:
        true if there are any queued events and opt out is inactive

      • setDispatchInterval

        public Tracker setDispatchInterval(long dispatchInterval)
        Set the interval to 0 to dispatch events as soon as they are queued. If a negative value is used the dispatch timer will never run, a manual dispatch must be used.
        Parameters:
        dispatchInterval - in milliseconds

      • getDispatchInterval

        public long getDispatchInterval()
        Returns:
        in milliseconds

      • setUserId

        public Tracker setUserId(String userId)
        Defines the User ID for this request. User ID is any non empty unique string identifying the user (such as an email address or a username). To access this value, users must be logged-in in your system so you can fetch this user ID from your system, and pass it to Piwik.

        When specified, the User ID will be "enforced". This means that if there is no recent visit with this User ID, a new one will be created. If a visit is found in the last 30 minutes with your specified User ID, then the new action will be recorded to this existing visit.

        Parameters:
        userId - passing null will delete the current user-id.

      • getUserId

        public String getUserId()
        Returns:
        a user-id string, either the one you set or the one Piwik generated for you.

      • setVisitorId

        public Tracker setVisitorId(String visitorId)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        The unique visitor ID, must be a 16 characters hexadecimal string. Every unique visitor must be assigned a different ID and this ID must not change after it is assigned. If this value is not set Piwik will still track visits, but the unique visitors metric might be less accurate.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • getVisitorId

        public String getVisitorId()

        Parameters:

      • trackScreenView

        public Tracker trackScreenView(String path,
                      String title)
        Parameters:
        path - for example: "/user/settings/billing"
        title - string The title of the action being tracked. It is possible to use slashes / to set one or several categories for this action. For example, Help / Feedback will create the Action Feedback in the category Help.
        Returns:
        this tracker

      • trackScreenView

                      String path,
                      String title)
        Parameters:
        trackMe - the track me objects to use
        path - for example: "/user/settings/billing"
        title - string The title of the action being tracked. It is possible to use slashes / to set one or several categories for this action. For example, Help / Feedback will create the Action Feedback in the category Help.
        Returns:
        this tracker

        public Tracker trackEvent(String category,
                 String action)

      • trackEvent

        public Tracker trackEvent(String category,
                 String action,
                 String label)

      • trackEvent

        public Tracker trackEvent(String category,
                 String action,
                 String label,
                 float value)
        Events are a useful way to collect data about a user's interaction with interactive components of your app, like button presses or the use of a particular item in a game.
        Parameters:
        category - (required) – this String defines the event category. You might define event categories based on the class of user actions, like clicks or gestures or voice commands, or you might define them based upon the features available in your application (play, pause, fast forward, etc.).
        action - (required) this String defines the specific event action within the category specified. In the example, we are basically saying that the category of the event is user clicks, and the action is a button click.
        label - defines a label associated with the event. For example, if you have multiple Button controls on a screen, you might use the label to specify the specific View control identifier that was clicked.
        value - defines a numeric value associated with the event. For example, if you were tracking "Buy" button clicks, you might log the number of items being purchased, or their total cost.

      • trackGoal

        public Tracker trackGoal(int idGoal)
        By default, Goals in Piwik are defined as "matching" parts of the screen path or screen title. In this case a conversion is logged automatically. In some situations, you may want to trigger a conversion manually on other types of actions, for example: when a user submits a form when a user has stayed more than a given amount of time on the page when a user does some interaction in your Android application
        Parameters:
        idGoal - id of goal as defined in piwik goal settings

      • trackGoal

        public Tracker trackGoal(int idGoal,
                float revenue)
        Tracking request will trigger a conversion for the goal of the website being tracked with this ID
        Parameters:
        idGoal - id of goal as defined in piwik goal settings
        revenue - a monetary value that was generated as revenue by this goal conversion.

      • trackOutlink

        public Tracker trackOutlink(URL url)
        Tracks an Outlink
        Parameters:
        url - HTTPS, HTTP and FTPare valid
        Returns:
        this Tracker for chaining

        public Tracker trackAppDownload()
        Default download tracking.
        Calls trackAppDownload(org.piwik.sdk.Tracker.ExtraIdentifier) with Tracker.ExtraIdentifier.NONE

      • trackAppDownload

        public Tracker trackAppDownload(Tracker.ExtraIdentifier extra)
        Fires a download for once per update.
        Parameters:
        extra - Tracker.ExtraIdentifier.APK_CHECKSUM or Tracker.ExtraIdentifier.NONE
        Returns:
        this tracker for chaining

      • trackNewAppDownload

        public Tracker trackNewAppDownload(Tracker.ExtraIdentifier extra)
        Sends a download event for this app

        Resulting download url:

        Case Tracker.ExtraIdentifier.APK_CHECKSUM:
        http://packageName:versionCode/apk-md5-checksum
        Usually the installer-packagename is something like "com.android.vending" (Google Play), but users can modify this value, don't be surprised by some random values.

        Case Tracker.ExtraIdentifier.NONE:
        http://packageName:versionCode

        Parameters:
        extra - Tracker.ExtraIdentifier.APK_CHECKSUM or Tracker.ExtraIdentifier.NONE
        Returns:
        this tracker again, so you can chain calls

      • trackContentImpression

        public Tracker trackContentImpression(String contentName,
                             String contentPiece,
                             String contentTarget)
        Tracking the impressions
        Parameters:
        contentName - The name of the content. For instance 'Ad Foo Bar'
        contentPiece - The actual content. For instance the path to an image, video, audio, any text
        contentTarget - (optional) The target of the content. For instance the URL of a landing page.

      • trackContentInteraction

        public Tracker trackContentInteraction(String interaction,
                              String contentName,
                              String contentPiece,
                              String contentTarget)
        Tracking the interactions
        Parameters:
        interaction - The name of the interaction with the content. For instance a 'click'
        contentName - The name of the content. For instance 'Ad Foo Bar'
        contentPiece - The actual content. For instance the path to an image, video, audio, any text
        contentTarget - (optional) The target the content leading to when an interaction occurs. For instance the URL of a landing page.

      • trackEcommerceCartUpdate

        public void trackEcommerceCartUpdate(int grandTotal,
                            EcommerceItems items)
        Tracks a shopping cart. Call this javascript function every time a user is adding, updating or deleting a product from the cart.
        Parameters:
        grandTotal - total value of items in cart
        items - (optional) the items included in the cart

      • trackEcommerceOrder

        public void trackEcommerceOrder(String orderId,
                       Integer grandTotal,
                       Integer subTotal,
                       Integer tax,
                       Integer shipping,
                       Integer discount,
                       EcommerceItems items)
        Tracks an Ecommerce order, including any ecommerce item previously added to the order. All monetary values should be passed as an integer number of cents (or the smallest integer unit for your currency)
        Parameters:
        orderId - (required) A unique string identifying the order
        grandTotal - (required) total amount of the order, in cents
        subTotal - (optional) the subTotal for the order, in cents
        tax - (optional) the tax for the order, in cents
        shipping - (optional) the shipping for the order, in cents
        discount - (optional) the discount for the order, in cents
        items - (optional) the items included in the order

      • trackException

        public void trackException(Throwable ex,
                  String description,
                  boolean isFatal)
        Caught exceptions are errors in your app for which you've defined exception handling code, such as the occasional timeout of a network connection during a request for data.

        This is just a different way to define an event. Keep in mind Piwik is not a crash tracker, use this sparingly.

        For this to be useful you should ensure that proguard does not remove all classnames and line numbers. Also note that if this is used across different app versions and obfuscation is used, the same exception might be mapped to different obfuscated names by proguard. This would mean the same exception (event) is tracked as different events by Piwik.

        Parameters:
        ex - exception instance
        description - exception message
        isFatal - true if it's fatal exception

      • injectInitialParams

        private void injectInitialParams(TrackMe trackMe)

      • injectBaseParams

      • makeRandomVisitorId

        public static String makeRandomVisitorId()

      • setVisitCustomVariable

        public Tracker setVisitCustomVariable(int index,
                             String name,
                             String value)
        A custom variable is a custom name-value pair that you can assign to your users or screen views, and then visualize the reports of how many visits, conversions, etc. for each custom variable. A custom variable is defined by a name — for example, "User status" — and a value – for example, "LoggedIn" or "Anonymous". You can track up to 5 custom variables for each user to your app.
        Parameters:
        index - this Integer accepts values from 1 to 5. A given custom variable name must always be stored in the same "index" per session. For example, if you choose to store the variable name = "Gender" in index = 1 and you record another custom variable in index = 1, then the "Gender" variable will be deleted and replaced with the new custom variable stored in index 1.
        name - String defines the name of a specific Custom Variable such as "User type".
        value - String defines the value of a specific Custom Variable such as "Customer".
